intro: Byrsonima intermedia f. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved mamey, is a shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are similar in appearance to those of the mamey sapote. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. The botanical features of this species make it an important plant in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
